title: Wall Street Secret Indicator Just Flashed. Bitcoin Pump Next?
transcript: Look at this. Small caps just tagged record highs. Gold, well, it went a little bit lower. And Bitcoin is still staring at the same red line like it's a locked door. So, here's the question that matters. Risk on is spreading across markets. Safe havens are cooling and the fear premium just yanked out of the system. So, does Bitcoin finally reclaim that red line resistance and confirm a fresh uptrend? Or are we walking into the same fake out that's burned people 10 times already? Stay with me, ladies and gentlemen, because in a few minutes, I'm going to give you a simple checklist you can use over the next week to separate a real breakout from another rejection. And there's one crossasset tell that's quietly leading this whole move. And again remember nothing in this video is financial advice. It's for educational purposes only. Let's start with the loudest signal in the room. Small caps they are ripping guys. The Russell 2000, which is the index of micro caps and small caps essentially, is sitting [music] around 2,698. And it's up about 8.7% this year already in just 22 days, up 8.7%. That's huge. Earlier push in the highest beta corner of the US equities. When small caps lead, it usually means one thing. risk appetite is moving out of this safe meggaap bunker and into the part of the market that needs confidence and liquidity to survive. This matters for crypto because Bitcoin tends to thrive when financial conditions feel easier. When investors start feeling brave again and when capital stops hiding. Small caps are saying go. Gold just stopped screaming run. We'll see how long that lasts, but at least for now. So, [music] why is Bitcoin still hesitating? Well, hold that thought, guys. Now, let's talk about what happened to the safety trade. Gold and precious metals got smoked today as the market processed easing trade tensions. That's a textbook unwind of defense positioning. Markets had been bracing for a fresh round of US Europe tariff escalation tied to the Greenland saga. But when that pressure released, the fear bid came out of gold. When safe haven stopped absorbing flows, those flows look for a new home. Sometimes it goes to equities, sometimes it goes to crypto, and sometimes it goes into both. So, this is the moment where Bitcoin should start acting like the risk on asset again, which brings us to the catalyst that flipped the switch. So, let's unpack the headline driver without getting lost in the drama. Over the last few days, markets whipped around on tariff threats tied to Greenland negotiations. Then at Davos, the tone changed. European markets rallied after Trump cancelled proposed tariffs against those eight European countries. And guess what? The retaliatory tariffs were also cancelled on the US from Europe. Some of these guys are calling this the taco trade, meaning Trump always chickens out. However, I think this is more strategic. There's a really good post from the Kobesi letter that I'll probably talk about early next week. So, the market heard tariffs canled and hit the risk on button. Yet, the situation still has moving parts and that keeps volatility in the air. For Bitcoin, volatility is fuel. It can also be a trap because when headlines drive the tape, you get wicks, you get stop hunts, you get fake outs. That's why this next part matters more than any single headline. Now, let's zoom out to the macro engine, official inflation, alternative inflation. So, you can feel the tension. One camp sees disinflation and starts chanting rate cuts. Well, by the time you guys watch this, we will have the news on the rate cuts, but Poly Market says it's about a 98% chance that we get no rate changes at all. So, that's been priced in. But the other camp, well, they look hard at activity data and they say slowed down because today's growth data was strong. As we talked about in our previous show, we're expecting to see probably five plus% in GDP and the labor market looks sturdy. It actually the un the lossless jobs loss job losses anyway, they were they came in lower than expected. So what does this mean for Bitcoin? It means the market is trying to price two stories at the same time. Story one, inflation is falling. Policy gets easier and liquidity rises. Story two, growth is strong, the Fed stays patient, risk assets chop sideways. Bitcoin, as do all markets, they hate confusion at resistance. Bitcoin loves clarity after the decision. So the real question becomes simple. Does Bitcoin get acceptance above the red line while the macro story stabilizes or does macro uncertainty keep pressing it back down? Now, the quiet tailwind that keeps showing up in these cycles is money supply is back at record levels right now. That's the M2 supply we talk about on a global and US basis. And on the Treasury side, buybacks are real again. We talked about this in previous shows recently. Also, I'm not saying that buybacks instantly pump Bitcoin. No, no. It's just the direction of the liquidity. Conversation is changing and markets frontr run that risk on doesn't need a tsunami. It starts with just these cracks in the wall that we're seeing right now. So, now let's get to the main event. Bitcoin right now is trading around $89,000 at the time of recording. And technically, this market has a very clean map. There's a big resistance band. Well, there's quite a few of them. one is that 94.5K zone that I said exists uh that we would really need to break and hold above. But then once you get back that there's two more resistance zones that are critical. One is that 976 zone or wherever we hit, you know, the the recent highs and then of course you have the $100,000 mark, which is psychological resistance. So those are your three red lines. Well, it's because markets have a really hard time when there is fear in the air. And this week, the rest of the market started whispering risk instead of fear. This look, this is what smart and big money are doing. And one thing I I think is important to mention, guys, is that we have these CME gaps, right? Because the CME is a futures exchange that trades Bitcoin, and on the weekends, it stops trading. So, we have often have these gaps that that for some reason the markets feel they need to be filled. And we're not going to have other decisions until next month. So, another month from now and even the who is going to become the next Fed chair is still a question mark. But we should find that out probably next week. And that could change a lot of things. That actually could change a lot of things, right? Because whoever is nominated as Fed chair will probably make a speech at some point and tell you what their policies are going to look like. And that could be very very dovish or it can be more conservative and be slightly hawkish. So, those could actually start the direction of a rally, but we'll have to watch and see when the new Fed chair is elected or nominated and then confirmed and then the speech that they make will really set the tone for 2026 and the way that policy is going to work. So, here's where we're at today, guys. The market just gave you a rare alignment. Risk appetite is spreading. Safe havens, well, they blinked quite a bit. Liquidity optics look better. It seems like liquidity is going to come in.
